abstract: The price war over books sold online takes a new twist as Amazon continues to sell some titles for $9 even after they are released.
snippet: The price war over books sold online takes a new twist as Amazon continues to sell some titles for $9 even after they are released.
lead_paragraph: Update | 2:04 p.m. In an e-mailed statement, Amy Lester, a spokeswoman for Walmart.com, said: “We remain committed to offering our customers the lowest prices online at Walmart.com, and will continue to adjust our pricing accordingly and as needed on these books.”

headline.main: The Online Price War Over Books Has a Fresh Twist (Or Two)

abstract: The company said it would pump $7 million into forest-protection projects in the Amazon, the Congo River Basin and the United States.
snippet: The company said it would pump $7 million into forest-protection projects in the Amazon, the Congo River Basin and the United States.
lead_paragraph: From the image-burnishment department: Trumpeting the benefit to gorillas in Africa and North American songbirds – not to mention “Andean spectacled bear and yellow-tailed woolly monkey in Peru” – Disney on Tuesday said it would pump $7 million into forest-protection projects in the Amazon, the Congo River Basin and the United States.

headline.main: Disney’s Green Initiative Takes Another Step
